titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices, a proclamation. Tho. Cantuar. Devonshire, Sunderland, Dorsett, Romney, Orford. Whereas in and by an Act of Parliament made and passed the last session of Parliament, intituled, An act for laying a duty on leather for the term of three years, and making other provision for answering the deficiencies as well of the late duties upon duties coal and culm, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lords Justices.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Charles Bill, and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb, deceas'd, printers to the King's most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening words of text.
At end: Given at the Court at Whitehall the seventh day of May, 1697. In the ninth year of His Majesties reign. God save the King.
Steele notation: Arms 128 on Leather will.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

person.persName: Charles Bill, and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb, deceas'd
